intro: Agauria salicifolia var. megalophylla, commonly known as the giant-leaf willow-leaf agauria, is a striking plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its large, willow-like leaves that can grow up to 30 inches in length. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its foliage is often a vibrant green, with some variation in color depending on the season and light exposure. The botanical features of this variant make it a notable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
